intro: Nephrodium foenisecii, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its dark green, palmately lobed leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread and form dense colonies. Nephrodium foenisecii is noted for its toxic properties, containing various alkaloids that can be harmful if ingested.
